title: Determine if method is abstract using `__isabstractmethod__` instead of `abstractmethod` decorator

labels.name: Needs investigation ðŸ”¬
labels.description: A bug or crash where it's not immediately obvious what is happenning

body:
### Current problem

I am trying to use my own decorator, with its own implementation, to denote abstract methods.

Currently, it appears we are determining abstraction solely on the [decorator used](https://github.com/pylint-dev/pylint/blob/fbbf7880b2e55673bb0e4ba0b1c6c06ca677d5d6/pylint/checkers/utils.py#L948).

The [decorator must be named](https://github.com/pylint-dev/pylint/blob/fbbf7880b2e55673bb0e4ba0b1c6c06ca677d5d6/pylint/checkers/utils.py#L45-L50) one of the following:

 - abc.abstractproperty
 - abc.abstractmethod
 - abc.abstractclassmethod
 - abc.abstractstaticmethod

### Desired solution

If a function is found to have the property `__isabstractmethod__` set to `True`, then this would suffice in determining if the method is abstract. Based on [Python's source code](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/b9831e5c98de280870b6d932033b868ef56fa2fa/Lib/abc.py#L7-L25), [this parameter](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/b9831e5c98de280870b6d932033b868ef56fa2fa/Lib/abc.py#L24) is the only implementation detail from the [`abstractmethod` decorator](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/b9831e5c98de280870b6d932033b868ef56fa2fa/Lib/abc.py#L7-L25).

Simplify put, if a function is found to have the attribute `__isabstractmethod__` set to `True`, then the pylint check [https://github.com/microsoft/pyright/blob/d58286a459e5a8afdd954e3e6033faa48cab5c0f/docs/configuration.md#reportGeneralTypeIssues](reportGeneralTypeIssues) should be satisfied.
